DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Cost-effectiveness Modified Pilates Method Versus Aerobic Exercise Patients With Fibromyalgia
DOC.detailed_description: Fibromyalgia rheumatologic disease characterize generalized chronic pain , hyperalgesia allodynia . Physical exercise recommend first choice non-pharmacological therapy . Thus , purpose study evaluate effectiveness cost-effectiveness modify Pilates method exercise compare aerobic exercise treatment patient fibromyalgia . For , follow outcome 98 patient evaluate blind evaluator baseline , 8 week , 6 12 month randomization : fibromyalgia impact assess Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire , pain intensity assess Pain Numerical Rating Scale , kinesiophobia assess Tampa Scale Kinesiophobia , specific disability assess Patient-Specific Functional Scale , functional capacity assess 6-minute Walk Test , quality sleep assess Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index , health-related quality life assess EQ-5D-3L SF-6D questionnaire . Participants randomly divide Aerobic Group , perform aerobic exercise treadmill and/or stationary bike , Pilates Group , perform exercise modify Pilates method . Both group treat eight week , twice week . The hypothesis Pilates exercise effective aerobic exercise improvement clinical outcome , improvement maintain medium long term . It also expect aerobic exercise cost-effective .
